subject: Physical Fitness
title: Cortisol and Stress
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cortisol and Stress usable.

hook.text: Cortisol is called the stress hormone. But during exercise, it's essential â€” it frees stored energy.

buildup.text: Short bursts of cortisol mobilize fat and glucose. It's your body's way of funding the workout.

discovery.text: Problems start when cortisol stays high. Chronic stress keeps it elevated, breaking down muscle.

twist.text: Overtraining mimics chronic stress. Too much exercise without rest raises cortisol and stalls gains.

climax.text: Moderate exercise lowers baseline cortisol over time. The key is intensity you can recover from.

punchline.text: Short cortisol spikes build you up. Chronic ones tear you down.

quiz.question: What happens when cortisol stays chronically elevated?
